thread.title: ASF Group secures $5M convertible note facility
thread.title_full: ASF Group secures $5M convertible note facility | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  Australia
title: ASF Group secures $5M convertible note facility
text:
(MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors) ASF Group ( ASX:AFA ) has secured a standby convertible note facility of up to 5 million over the next 12 months from Star Diamond Developments Limited positioning the company for additional value creation.
    
The convertible note facility has a maturity date of 31st December 2016 if drawn down.

The notes can be converted into AFA shares at a conversion price representing a 10% discount to the 30-day VWAP.    

The parties will enter into a convertible note deed if the facility is drawn down.

Star Diamond has provided multiple convertible note facilities over the past three years.


Recent Activity

In August it raised 7.5 million through an issue of convertible notes with a face value of 1.00 each to a series of sophisticated investors.

The company is part of the S&P/ASX All Ordinaries Index which consists of the largest 500 companies listed on the Australian exchange reaching a larger universe of fund managers and sophisticated investors.

This will assist with planning on its multi-million dollar integrated casino and resort development on the Gold Coast. 

ASF also reached an agreement with the Queensland Government to start planning for the new casino and resort on state-owned land next to Sea World at Main Beach.

This is likely to target the growing Asian tourism market adding an internationally recognised tourism destination and thousands of long term jobs to the Gold Coast.
ASF Consortium is working with the State Government to determine proposal timeframes and processes. It will submit a detailed proposal for the new site which covers about five hectares.



Value adding 

Net assets have increased to 28442000 in the most recent financial year up from 18299000 in 2014.

This was due to full settlement of the Star Diamond Convertible Loan an ncrease in capitalised Gold Coast Integrated Resort (‘GCIR’) project costs of 7020000 and an increase in capitalised exploration expenditures for the year of 1199000.

Further investments in Rey Resources (ASX:REY) ActivEX Limited ( ASX:AIV ) Key Petroleum Limited ( ASX:KEY ) and Metaliko Resources Limited ( ASX:MKO ) totalling 4337000; and repayment of the 2122000 Willaton Loan.

During FY2015 ASF increased its stake in ActivEX to 19.55% by subscribing for 40 million shares priced at 0.02 and its interest in Metaliko to 17.17% through a private placement and on-market purchase.

It also holds approximately 18.26% of the issued share capital of Rey while its wholly-owned subsidiary ASF Oil & Gas Holdings Pty Ltd holds 19.54% of Key.

Analysis 

The 5 million standby convertible note facility from Star Diamond Developments provides ASF with additional working capital if required.

This adds to the recent 7.5 million convertible note issue as the company progresses planning and developing of the integrated resort and casino.

A share buy back has assisted AFA shareholders; the company’s ongoing share buyback has tightened its issued capital and the share price has been a strong performer up 88% since 1st January.

As at 30 June 2015 ASF had a cash balance of 4229000.
